adverts.name: Public Service Co-ordinating Bargaining Council (PSCBC)
adverts.about_us: VISION A Bargaining Council positioned to advance and influence change in the labour market environment.MISSION Promoting sound labour relations through collective bargaining and dispute management both locally and internationally.The powers and functions of the PSCBC are listed in section 28 of the LRA.The main purpose of the PSCBC is to provide a platform,both nationally and provincially,for Public Service parties to:�Negotiate Resolutions on transverse matters,including terms and conditions of the employment of public servants;�Prevent and resolve disputes through mediation and arbitration;�Facilitate hearings to resolve disputes that arise in the Public Service(over which the PSCBC has jurisdiction);and to� Promote good governance,inclusive of research and strategic partnerships.The parties to the PSCBC consist of a 50 % representation from both the Government and Trade Unions as Parties.This combination ensures that the PSCBC remains impartial,independent and unbiased at all times.The PSCBC Secretariat is responsible for the administrative functions of the Council.The Secretariat consists of the employees of the Council,headed by the General Secretary to the Council.

adverts.name: Tsolwana Local Municipality
adverts.about_us: The Tsolwana Municipality comprises the two former Transitional Local Councils (TLCs) of Tarkastad and Hofmeyr and that of the Ntabethemba TRC. The headquarters are situated in Tarkastad. Tarkastad lies in the northern part of the Province of the Eastern Cape, Hofmeyr in the north eastern part and Ntabethemba in the southern part. The two former TLCs are semiurban areas while Ntabethemba is 100% rural.The municipality�s population is estimated at 32,511 as per the 2001 census. The major economic activity in the area is farming and the two towns are surrounded by commercial farms. Some parts of the municipal area in Tarkastad are suitable for crop farming while others specialize mainly in animal farming with a growing trend towards game farming.

adverts.about_us: Our MissionTo be the trusted service provider of utmost quality.�To deliver quality at light speed!To break all quickest claimed service delivery level agreements.�To give our clients a smooth soaring experience.��VALUES� We believe that we exist because of� you�� the client.That is why you will always be at the heart of whatever we do .�In all our business dealings with you, we will with UTMOST INTEGRITY and with POSITIVITY GO AN EXTRA MILE CONQUERING NEVER to deliver to you INNOVATIVE solutions of unmatchable QUALITY;and give you a WOW CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE for the lifespan of our HEALTHY business RELATIONSHIP with you.�Our core values are therefore built around you.��ABOUT US� Time Keeper Holdings is a 100 % Black owned company founded by Sam Sekgolea(the owner - manager) in 2008. Time Keeper Holdings is a professional Industrial supplies company whose core aim is to provide and delight clients with high quality products at competitive prices.Time Keeper is a Level 1 BEE company and operates under the mentorship of the Shanduka Black Umbrellas Entrepreneurs Programme.�Our aim is to help organisations achieve the agility they require to compete in a technologically challenging and changing world.We will work with you and share our expertise and experience so that you can focus on running your core business, having peace of mind from our quality product solutions.�Our Resources� The right people are our greatest resource,it is therefore pivotal that Timekeeper has the right people on the bus before starting a journey towards excellence.�Providing Quality Products and Services rely on the involvement of people for the ultimate success in all processes and strategies.We ensure that our people have the required capabilities and skills to meet customer requirements.�People working within the company have solid experience and capability in areas of expertise and deeper specialized skills.�Quality� In the competitive environment we operate in ,quality is an important differentiator and influences our reputation.We keep this in mind every time we deliver products to a client.That is how we maintain our client satisfaction levels high and retain their loyalty.�Our products meet the ISO 9001 quality standards asset by the International Organisation for Standardisation and are approved by the South African Bureau of Standards(SABS).

adverts.name: Mota-Engil Construction South Africa (Pty) Ltd
adverts.about_us: Mota-Engil Construction South Africa (Pty) Ltd. (MECSA) is part of Mota- Engil Africa N.V. who is a leading provider of integrated engineering and construction services and a wide range of other activities within Africa. It provides a diversified portfolio of services ranging from Engineering and Construction (Including Infrastructure such as roads, railways, bridges and dams, civil construction works and real estate construction and services), Transports and Logistics (Including ports and other infrastructure management), Environment and Services (Including waste management and collection as well as water treatment and distribution). Mota - Engil Construction South Africa is a South African CIBD Grade 9 Construction Company bringing with it the experience of 68 years from Mota - Engil Africa building African Cities.It joins the ranks of 10 other countries where Mota - Engil Africa is operating, countries like Angola, Mozambique, Malawi, Cape Verde, Sao Tome e Principe, Ghana, Uganda, Zimbabwe, Zambia and Rwanda.The Completion of a railway in Malawi, to a Bridge in Mozambique, and a Dam in Angola, the Mota - Engil Brand is known for quality and excellence and this is what it brings to South Africa and Africa.

adverts.name: Fikile Construction (Pty) Ltd
adverts.about_us: Fikile Construction (Pty) Ltd is a building and civil engineering construction company established in 1986. Fikile Construction is one of the largest black-owned, managed and controlled construction companies in the country. Throughout its years of pursuing excellence, the company has successfully earned recognition as a significant player in the South African building and construction industry landscape. Fikile plays a pivotal role in the provision of social and commercial infrastructure through its unique management capabilities, and is a contributing partner in South Africa's transforming economy. Fikile Construction has a CIDB 9 GB and 7 CE PE status and a Level 2 BBBEE status. Today's economic trends have forced many companies to downsize or reorganize their assets in order to meet their bottom line goals, and deliver in a way that meets clients' expectations. At Fikile, we believe that consultants and professional teams are also clients. We therefore strive to provide flexible, end-to-end solutions that will assist our customers in meeting their objectives by giving the best possible service, at a competitive pricing structure with the highest level of quality.

adverts.name: Ngaphaya Y2K10 Trading CC
adverts.about_us: Ngaphaya Y2K10 Trading CC (meaning BEYOND 2010) was established in October 2008 and is a 100% Black female-owned business. It currently boasts with Level 1 B-BBEE recognition status. There are 3 streams within the business: 1. Human Capital Development through enterprise development focusing on franchising, retail and SMME development; 2. Sourcing/Procurement for government tenders (It currently has a distributor agreement with Jocastro and Night Vision Optics); and 3. Future Growth through SMME contract finance, imports and exports, as well as Joint Ventures. Nature of Organisation Business Activity: Our vision is to be the centre of excellence specialising within the chosen market, thereby becoming a BEE female supplier of choice, as well as add to the growth of the South African economy. Products and Services: Ngaphaya supplies the following products: Railway equipment, specialized diving gear, search lights, chemicals, tools, PERT training equipment, sub - stations and transformers, leak - free toilet cistern, and plastic sanitary ware.It also provides Human Capital Development through consultations, franchise workshops and SMME development.
